'''Google Inc.''' ({{nasdaq|GOOG}} and {{lse|GGEA}}) is an [[United States|American]] [[public company|public corporation]], specializing in [[Internet search]] and [[online advertising]]. The company had 10,674 full-time employees as of [[December 31]], [[2006]], and is based in [[Mountain View, California]]. Google's mission statement is "to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful."<ref>"[http://www.google.com/corporate/ Google Corporate Information: Company Overview]." ''[[Google]].'' Retrieved on [[January 6]], [[2007]].</ref>
'''Google Inc.''' ({{nasdaq|GOOG}} and {{lse|GGEA}}) is an [[United States|American]] [[public company|public corporation]], specializing in [[Internet search]] and [[online advertising]]. The company had 10,674 full-time employees as of [[December 31]], [[2006]], and is based in [[Mountain View, California]]. Google's mission statement is "to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful."<ref>"[http://www.google.com/corporate/ Google Corporate Information: Company Overview]." ''[[Google]].'' Retrieved on [[January 6]], [[2007]].</ref>
â
Google was co-founded by [[Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]] while they were students at [[Stanford University]], and the company was first incorporated as a [[privately held company]] on [[September 7]] [[1998]]. Google's initial public offering took place on [[August 19]], [[2004]], raising [[United States Dollar|$]]1.67 billion, making the company worth $23 billion.<ref name="washpost">Webb, Cynthia L. "[http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/articles/A14939-2004Aug19.html Google's IPO: Grate Expectations]." ''[[Washington Post]].'' [[August 19]], [[2004]]. Retrieved on [[February 25]], [[2007]].</ref>
+
Google was co-founded by [[Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]] while they were students at [[Stanford University]], and the company was first incorporated as a [[privately held company]] on [[September 7]] [[1998]]. Google's initial public offering took place on [[August 19]], [[2004]], raising [[United States Dollar|$]]1.67 billion, making it worth $23 billion.<ref name="washpost">Webb, Cynthia L. "[http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/articles/A14939-2004Aug19.html Google's IPO: Grate Expectations]." ''[[Washington Post]].'' [[August 19]], [[2004]]. Retrieved on [[February 25]], [[2007]].</ref>
Google is particularly known for its relaxed corporate culture. Their corporate philosophy is based on many casual principles including, "You can make money without doing evil", "You can be serious without a suit," and "Work should be challenging and the challenge should be fun." This relaxed culture can also be seen externally through their holiday variations of the [[Google logo]], as well as their various [[Google's hoaxes|hoaxes and April Fool's Day jokes]].
Google is particularly known for its relaxed corporate culture. Their corporate philosophy is based on many casual principles including, "You can make money without doing evil", "You can be serious without a suit," and "Work should be challenging and the challenge should be fun." This relaxed culture can also be seen externally through their holiday variations of the [[Google logo]], as well as their various [[Google's hoaxes|hoaxes and April Fool's Day jokes]].
